refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Amanda uses interactivity to ask user to load specific volumes when they are needed. This manual page describes the interactivity modules included with Amanda.

This is a user-level description of the API, and does not address details that are only of concern to developers. For that purpose, consult the Amanda source code, perldoc 'Amanda::Interactivity' and http://wiki.zmanda.com.

refsect1.title: DEFINING INTERACTIVITY
refsect1.para:
An interactivity is defined in &amconf; as follows:
define interactivity $interactivity_name { comment "$comment" plugin "$pluginname" property "$PROPERTY_NAME" "$PROPERTY_VALUE" ... }
and then referenced in the global section as
interactivity "$interactivity_name"
Interactivity properties, like Amanda configuration parameters, are insensitive to case, and - (dash) and _ (underscore) may be used interchangeably.
See the individual plugin documentation for properties applicable to each plugin.

refsect1.title: INTERACTIVITY MODULES
refsect1.para: Amanda provides three interactivity modules, tty, email and tty_email.

refsect2.title: TTY
refsect2.para: The tty interactivity module use the tty to communicate with the user, it works only if a tty is available, which is the case if amanda is executed from a command line.

When promted for a volume, the user must put the requested volume in the changer and type <enter>. User can type the name of another changer if the volume is available in that changer. Typing 'abort' will abort the operation.

refsect2.title: EMAIL
refsect2.para: The email interactivity module use the email to send request to the user and read reply from the filesystem.
The email module have many properties:

varlistentry.listitem: If set, amanda check this file for user input. User can touch the file to tell amanda that the volume was inserted in the changer, user can write the name of a changer in the file to tell amanda to use a different changer or the word 'abort' to abort the scan.
Default: 10. This integer property indicates the time in seconds amanda wait before each check of the check-file.
The email addresses where to send the email. The default is the globally configured mailto.
Default 0.: The time in seconds amanda wait before resending the email.

refsect2.title: TTY_EMAIL
refsect2.para: The tty_email interactivity module use the tty module if a tty is available and use the email module if a tty is not available. Looks at the description of these two modules.

para.programlisting: define interactivity "by-tty-or-email" { comment "by-tty-or-email" plugin "tty_email" property "mailto" "admin1" "admin2" "me@home" property "resend-delay" "1800" #every 30 minutes property "check-file" "/tmp/email_input" property "check-file-delay" "10" #every 10 seconds }
